Will there be both tech tree and sand box? (Like KSP?)

I am contemplating how to make that work. An idea I had is that you could perhaps start a new game at different points on the tech tree, like in Civilization. So, if you wanted to start at the endgame with everything available, you could.

Some questions:

-How many different kinds of creatures are there going to be? A few dozen? A few hundred?

-Will there be binary and multiple stars in the game?

-How about planetary rings?

Antennas, neither really textured yet:

Some questions:

1-How many different kinds of creatures are there going to be? A few dozen? A few hundred?

2-Will there be binary and multiple stars in the game?

3-How about planetary rings?

1. Unknown. Likely a few dozen at best. But, they hopefully will be completely moddable, so new ones can be very easily added as time goes on.

2. Yes, most likely

3. No. Unless it has a constant source of material, the ring will be dispersed quite quickly due to the lack of any stable orbits

How will the interior work? How will we interact with it?

How will the interior work? How will we interact with it?

The interior will be where you manage all program operations. You physically walk around it, in different locations around it are things like the primary command console, the part inventory, the construction station, the transfer portal, etc.

Certain things will need to be carried around as well, such as drums of propellant (often hydrazine, don't trip) and returned samples.
So if you drop the Hydrazine tank, bad stuff will happen?
If you consider explosive combustion to be bad, then...

Made a HUD setup for determining prograde and retrograde.

From left to right: Retrograde, prograde, ship retrograde, ship prograde.

In action:

.ship retrograde, ship prograde.

*raises hand*

What do these mean?

*raises hand*

What do these mean?

I believe ship prograde is where you are pointed and ship retrograde is where you are not pointed.

So if your camera is locked to the orientation of the vessel, (think KSP chase cam or cockpit cam) these two markers should appear static on your screen.

I believe ship prograde is where you are pointed and ship retrograde is where you are not pointed.

So if your camera is locked to the orientation of the vessel, (think KSP chase cam or cockpit cam) these two markers should appear static on your screen.

Yes. They're locked to vessel orientation, not camera orientation, though. So if your camera is angled relative to the ship, the marker will be offset to reflect that, still pointing along the ship's forward axis.
